headline.main: A RITZ-CARLTON GRADUATE.; Klicks Returns to Hotel in Berlin with A.H.M. Degree.

docs.abstract: receives degree of A. H. M. from Ritz-Carlton Hotel
docs.lead_paragraph: The Ritz-Carlton sent out yesterday another graduating class composed of one, on whom Manager Keller conferred, it is said, the degree of A.H.M. The graduate was Gunther Klicks, son of the proprietor of one of the big hotels in Berlin, who for three years, has been pursuing a course in American hotel methods, and who sailed yesterday on the Philadelphia for home.

headline.main: GRAND UNION HOTEL NOW ONLY A MEMORY; Its Doors Closed for Good at Midnight After a Busy Last Day for the Clerks.

docs.lead_paragraph: An old gong with a cracked voice almost lost in the winding passages that lead from the lobby, past the bar, through the grill back to the Flemish Room of the Grand Union Hotel, struck twelve last night, and the doors of the famous hostelry were closed.

headline.main: GENTLE SUFFRAGISTS ONLY.; No Amazonian Guard at Celebration in Parks To-morrow.

docs.abstract: art collections and prints removed, comment of Simeon Ford
docs.lead_paragraph: Word had gone out that Mrs. Stanton Blatch was to have twenty-five amazons to augment the regular police force and held keep the peace at the Mall, in Central Park, where the Women's Political Union is to have its special part of the big suffrage day celebration tomorrow Afternoon.

docs.abstract: Editorial on London's new no-tip hotel
docs.lead_paragraph: We owe to Mr. W.D. HOWELLS, who, having just returned from England, has been "interviewed" in The Sun, some fresh, first-hand information about London's new "no tip" hotel. Mr. HOWELLS has found tipping in England "pretty nearly as bad as it is here." That seems to be a fair statement of the case.

headline.main: WEST STREET BLOCK UNDER THE HAMMER; Property at Duane and Reade Streets, Which Has Figured in Many Projects. ONCE OWNED BY THE CITY Broadway Leaseholds On Thirteenth and Eighteenth Street Corners to be Offered This Week.

docs.abstract: Bldg of new hotel in Glen Cove, LI, begun
docs.lead_paragraph: Judging by announcements already made, the auction market promises to be very busy during the month of May. Joseph P. Day has three large sales on for the next ten days, and others of much importance later in the month, including, on May 20, the property occupying the entire block bounded by Washington, West, Reade, and Duane Streets.

headline.main: POILLON SISTERS DRAG IN BARLOW; Declare in Court That the Magistrate Promised to Pay Their Hotel Bills. SAY HE BORROWED $25,000 Magistrate on the Stand Admits Knowing Them, but Denies Their Story -- Pair Convicted as Hotel Beats.

docs.abstract: K and C Poillon, convicted of being professional hotel swindlers, say they lent $25,000 to P T Barlow, pres of Bd of NYC Magistrates, and he promised to pay their hotel bills
docs.lead_paragraph: Declaring they had been railroaded "because we have the goods on too many prominent New Yorkers," the Poillon sisters, Kathryn and Charlotte, long known in the hotel district, crossed the Bridge of Sighs to the Tombs prison yesterday after having been convicted in the Special Sessions of being professional hotel beats.
